snippet: The resignation of Philipp M. Hildebrand over personal currency deals came as a surprise since he appeared to have the support of the council that oversees the Swiss National Bank.
abstract: Swiss National Bank chief Philipp M Hildebrand unexpectedly resigns, saying doubts about currency trades he and his wife made in 2011 threaten to undermine his ability to focus on steering the bank through a global financial crisis; resignation comes as a surprise, since he appeared to have support of the council that oversees the central bank.
lead_paragraph: The resignation of Philipp M. Hildebrand over personal currency deals came as a surprise since he appeared to have the support of the council that oversees the Swiss National Bank.

headline.seo: Swiss Bank Chief Quits After Uproar Over Trades
headline.main: Swiss Central Bank Chief Resigns After Uproar
headline.print_headline: Swiss Bank Chief Quits Amid Uproar on Trades
